column4: hi, I'm trying to attach a new hard disk to my server, sudo lshw -C disk shows that capabilities: partitioned partitioned:dos
however sudo mount -t msdos /dev/sdb /media/old5
says "wrong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on /dev/sdb"
so how do I mount it?
with no type it says "mount: you must specify the filesystem type"
its likely a fat/vfat or ntfs if it came from m$
it's not from m$ this is the previous hard disk I had ubuntu on , I need to copy data
are you sure that it is the whole disk and not a partition?
what is the whole disk and not a partition?
/dev/sdb is a whole disk /dev/sdb1 is the first partition
generally the OS or whatever your looking for is installed to a partition and not a whole disk
so should I try to mount sdb1 ?
so use fdisk to print the partitions and choose the proper one
Nicolas_Leonida2:no guessing needed, simply fdisk -l /dev/sdb
maybe as sudo =)
it shows sdb1,2,5,6,7,8,9,10,11 so they need to be mounted indipendently each?
once you get the partition fix the command to mount that one instead of the complete disk
no
can you gist/post your fdisk -l /dev/sdb output?
sure, one sec
there we go http://pastebin.com/7SmgtpMR
most likely /dev/sdb1
lol why did you have so many partitions
yup, you got it! works now
